data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can only take 5 steps backward. If you take 6 steps backward, you will take 5 steps backward, and in 6 steps go to facing forward; this will be the end. If you always take 6 steps backward, you take 6 steps forward; in 6 steps, there should be 10 additional steps. In 8 steps backward, you take in 18 steps, 1 of which should be towards the starting point; in 8 steps backward, there should be 10 additional steps. Thus, in 8 steps backward, they are 10 additional steps which will take you back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
